articles.previewText: Kimbrady Carriker, 40, a Black Lives Matter supporter who made numerous posts about guns shot dead four men and a 15-year-old boy in Philadelphia on the eve of the Fourth of July.

articleText.content:
• Kimbrady Carriker, 40, shot dead four men and a 15-year-old boy in the Kingsessing neighborhood on the eve of the Fourth of July
  • He is now in custody and facing multiple murder charges after rampaging through the streets with an AR-15, a handgun and wearing a ballistic vest
  • Facebook posts from March 2022 show Carriker dressed as a woman, wearing a bra, hooped earrings and gold bracelets 

The Philadelphia gunman who left five dead has been unmasked as a cross-dressing Black Lives Matter supporter who made chilling Facebook posts about 'evil spirits.'

Kimbrady Carriker, 40, shot dead four men and a 15-year-old boy in the Kingsessing neighborhood on the eve of the Fourth of July.

He is now in custody and facing multiple murder charges after rampaging through the streets with an AR-15, a handgun and wearing a ballistic vest.

The killer has now been revealed to be a computer nerd who was obsessed by firearms - even posting video a few days ago of children at a gun range.

Facebook posts from March 2022 show Carriker dressed as a woman, wearing a bra, hooped earrings and gold bracelets. 

He had posted eerie articles to Facebook titled: 'How do you know if an evil spirit is following you,' as well as a photo of a map listing historic 'black massacres' throughout the US with the caption stating: 'We kept the receipts.'

articleText.caption: Kimbrady Carriker, 40, shot dead four men and a 15-year-old boy in the Kingsessing neighborhood on the eve of the Fourth of July (pictured: a Facebook post from March 2022 show Carriker dressed as a woman, wearing a bra, hooped earrings and gold bracelets)
Carriker dressed as a woman in a Facebook post from last March
Carriker in a Facebook post from October 2011
Facebook posts reveal the killer is a computer nerd who is obsessed by firearms - even posting video a few days ago of children at a gun range
Kimbrady Carriker, 40, of Philadelphia, was arrested shortly after a mass shooting in Kingsessing on the eve of Fourth of July that left five men dead and two children wounded

articleText.content:
He was also using a police scanner in an attempt to stay a step ahead of the cops but was ultimately backed into an alleyway where he surrendered.

City officials held a press conference earlier Tuesday during which they refused to name the suspect and said they were unable to provide any motive for the attack.

The victims were named as Ralph Moralis, 59; Joseph Wamah, 31; Dymir Stanton, 29; Lashyd Merritt, 20; and Daujan Brown, 15.

Before the press conference police sources confirmed to the Philadelphia Inquirer that Carriker was the 40-year-old suspect arrested last night. 

Families had been enjoying the festivities in the neighborhood when the gunman wearing a bullet proof vest wielding an AR-style rifle and handgun opened fire on his unsuspecting victims.

A mother and daughter who lived with Carriker on the 5600 block of Belmar Terrace back in 2021 were shocked to find out he was named as a suspect in the massacre.

Tina Rosette, 49, told the Philadelphia Inquirer that Carriker was 'really smart, intelligent, creative,' and loved working on computer programs.

Rosette added that she while she had never seen Carriker with a gun, she admitted that he had 'an aggressive approach to some things in life.'

She recalled that Carriker sometimes taught people how to fight in self-defense, but she claimed he did not give them much direction about how or when to stop.

But Rosette's 24-year-old daughter Cianni said that she had seen Carriker's handgun and that he was 'trying to get me comfortable around guns and stuff like that.'

On his social media pages, Carriker regularly posted about supporting Black Lives Matter, including his support for workers who protested in the Strike For Black Lives in July 2020.

He had also shared images of items of clothing with phrases like ‘the first amendment defines us, the second amendment defends us’ on them.

Another hooded sweatshirt includes branding that says: ‘I lubricate my AR-15 liberal tears.’

One other design includes the eerie phrase: ‘Know this we are many they are few. To fear death is a choice and they can’t hang us all.’ 

Besides this, Carriker had also shared images showing support for former President Donald Trump and promoting being Vegan in another.

articleText.caption: Bullet holes found on the side of a parked truck are marked as police officers work at the scene the day after a shooting in the Kingsessing section of southwest Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

articleText.headline: Aftermath of Philadelphia shooting that left five dead

articleText.caption: District Attorney Larry Krasner listens to community members who comfort each other following a mass shooting in the Kingsessing section of southwest Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

articleText.headline: Suspect wearing ballistic vest opens fire in Philly, killing four

articleText.content:
District Attorney Larry Krasner tweeted on Tuesday that he visited the scene of the shooting and met with community members. 

'Our hearts are broken over last night’s horrific shooting, and my deepest condolences go out to everyone impacted.

'I was on site this morning and met with a witness, a family member of a victim, police, neighbors and electeds.'

Philadelphia police were dispatched to 56th Street and Chester Avenue around 8:30 p.m. Monday night where they found several victims.

Security camera video viewed later shows the shooter walking down the street calmly while firing at people before responding officers chased the suspect as he continued to fire.

articleText.caption: Families had been enjoying the festivities in the neighborhood when the gunman wearing a bullet proof vest wielding an AR-style rifle and handgun opened fire on his victims
Philadelphia police were dispatched to 56th Street and Chester Avenue around 8:30 p.m. Monday night where they found several victims and shell casings scattered on the pavement

articleText.content: Police Commissioner Danielle Outlaw said at a news conference overnight that she did not know if the suspect was firing from his rifle or handgun at the time he was chased by cops, but confirmed he was 'actively shooting'.

The officers then heard multiple gunshots further up the street on Kingsessing Avenue where they found 'multiple casings'. The cops advanced further down the street before hearing more gunshots in the area of 1800 block of Frazier Street. 

Officers were then able to apprehend the suspect in the rear alley of 1600 block of Frazier street and found he was armed with the rifle, handgun, multiple magazines and a police scanner. The police did not fire any shots themselves. 

'Thank God our officers responded as quickly as they did. I can't even describe the level of bravery and courage that was shown,' Outlaw said.

articleText.caption: Bullet holes found on the side of a parked truck are marked as police officers work at the scene the day after a shooting in the Kingsessing section of southwest Philadelphia
District Attorney Larry Krasner tweeted on Tuesday that he visited the scene of the shooting and met with community members
District Attorney Larry Krasner and other officials are walk through the neighborhood after last night's shooting

articleText.headline: Philadelphia police provide update on Fourth of July shooting

articleText.caption: The total number of victims increased overnight and police said a fifth male victim was found four hours after the shooting when a man returned home and found his 31-year-old son dead in the living room with multiple gunshots wounds
Police place a rifle in a bag on the scene of a shooting on July 3 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
Officials had described the scene as covering an area of two by four blocks and said around 50 spent shell casings were found

articleText.content:
Outlaw said at a news conference that all of the victims of the mass shooting were male, including the two-year-old and the 13-year-old. A mass shooting is defined by the FBI as an incident in which at least four people are murdered with a gun.

The total number of victims increased overnight and police said a fifth male victim was found four hours after the shooting when a man returned home and found his 31-year-old son dead in the living room with multiple gunshots wounds. 

'We believe because of where he was found and where his house is on 56th Street, and the fact that we found ballistic evidence that matches the ballistic evidence we found on the street a few hours earlier, we believe this homicide is related,' Philadelphia Police Chief Inspector Scott Small said.

Tim Eads said that Monday night he heard fireworks, then gunshots, and saw police cars 'flying by.' His wife was on the second floor 'looking out the bay window and saw the shooter actually coming down this street here behind me.' 

Eads saw the other man with a pistol who, he said, may have been firing at the shooter.

'He was using my car as a shield shooting out into the street,' Eads said.

A resident named Roger who declined to give his last name said he and his family were eating in the living room at about 8:30 p.m. when they heard eight to 10 gunshots.

'Everybody thought it was fireworks but ... been around here about three years so I heard it enough,' he said. 'I looked out the window and seen a bunch of people running.'

He said he heard about four more shots and 'thought it was the end of it.'

articleText.caption: A bicycle at the scene of the shooting at 56th Street and Chester Avenue in Philadelphia
An evidence marker is seen as investigations are ongoing the day after a mass shooting
A resident named Roger who declined to give his last name said he and his family were eating in the living room at about 8:30 p.m. when they heard eight to 10 gunshots

articleText.content:
Ten minutes later, he said, police came 'flying down here,' and about five minutes later he heard rapid gunfire open up right outside the house.

The Philadelphia violence is the country's 29th mass killing in 2023, the highest on record by this time in the year. And the Kingsessing neighborhood is becoming more and more dangerous, locals say.

The numbers people killed in such events is also the highest by this time in the year.

There have been more than 550 mass killings since 2006, according to the database, in which at least 2,900 people have died and at least 2,000 people have been hurt.

articles.headline: Missing Massachusetts woman who was last seen a week ago is found alive after getting stuck in MUD for three days before hikers heard her screams
articles.socialHeadline: Woman found alive after getting stuck in MUD for three days
articles.previewText: A Massachusetts woman was found stuck in the mud of a state park a week after going missing.

articleText.content:
• Emma Tetewsky was found by hikers after they heard her screaming for help in a swampy area of Borderlands State Park on July 3
  • Police believe Tetewsky may have been stuck in the mud for at least three days  
  • She was taken to a local hospital with serious injuries but is expected to recover 

A Massachusetts woman has been found alive stuck in the mud at a state park a week after going missing.

Emma Tetewsky, 31, was reported missing around noon on June 26 by her concerned family, launching a multi-agency search, including the use of State Police Air Wing, K-9s, drones and boats.  

Tetewsky was believed to still be in the area since she did not have access to a car, had not taken her cellphone with her and was known to pray in the local woods. 

Stoughton Police announced on Monday that the young woman had been found by hikers stuck in the mud of Borderlands State Park, about 30 miles south of Boston.  

Hikers reportedly heard her screams for help in a swampy area but were unable to reach the woman by foot. They alerted Easton police and directed them to her location.

articleText.caption: Emma Tetewsky, 31, was reported missing around noon on June 26 by her concerned family
Easton Police Department used ATVs to help free Tetewsky from the swampy mud

articleText.content:
'Three officers waded 50 feet from the shore, through thick brush and swamp, to reach Tetewsky. 

'It is believed that she may have been trapped at that location for at least three days,' Stoughton Police said in a statement.

'Utilizing ATV's, Easton PD undertook rescue efforts to reach Emma and free her as she was stuck in the mud for several days' police added. 

Although alert and conscious when finally freed, Tetewsky was first given immediate medical treatment by Easton firefighters and then taken to Good Samaritan Hospital with serious injuries. She is expected to recover.
'There were so many agencies involved in the search for Emma over the last week,' the police statement said.

articleText.caption: Stoughton Police announced on Monday that the young woman had been found by hikers stuck in the mud of Borderlands State Park, about 30 miles south of Boston

articleText.content:
'We thank everyone involved. The public never gave up hope that she would be located safely. She could not have been located without the public's help, ' it added.

Stoughton Police Chief Donna McNamara said: 'If it wasn’t for the public helping us and giving us tips over the last five days, we wouldn’t have been able to locate her. This is the best possible outcome.'

Borderland State Park is known for its many hiking and biking trails as well as other outdoor pursuits such as horse-riding, fishing and golf.

articles.headline: 'This is garbouj!' Bethenny Frankel rants about lackluster international airport lounge at Newark and shows off unappetizing food selection - after spending $6K on airfare
articles.socialHeadline: Bethenny Frankel rants about lackluster international airport lounge

relatedArticles.headline: Rihanna looks incredible just two months after giving birth as she enjoys a date night with A$AP Rocky to celebrate his 35th birthday
Jennifer Lopez cheers herself up by shopping for plants for new $60m mansion after THAT tense outing with Ben Affleck
Sia shows off her smooth complexion after facelift at 47 as she poses with glamorous Jennifer Lopez, 54

articles.previewText: The Real Housewives Of New York star, 52, gave fans a tour of the lackluster lounge on her Instagram account, blasting it as 'garbouj' and rating it 'disgusto.'

articleText.content: Bethenny Frankel had a word of warning for future flyers expecting a first class experience at the La Compagnie terminal at Newark Airport - don't.

The former Real Housewives Of New York star, 52, gave fans a tour of the lackluster lounge and terminal on her Instagram account, blasting it as 'garbouj' and rating it 'disgusto.'

For the price of her $6400 roundtrip flight with La Compagnie, an all-business class airline, Bethenny was flabbergasted by just how disappointing their terminal was.  

'The international terminals are really one of the most exciting parts about traveling, except for the La Compagnie Terminal. Non event,' she began as she toured around the terminal.

'This is the whole pretty much terminal. And the duty free is garbouj,' Bethenny, who recently appeared on the Today show, said.

articleText.headline: Bethenny Frankel slams $6K international airport lounge in rant

articleText.caption: 'This is garbouj!' Bethenny Frankel had a word of warning for future flyers expecting a luxurious experience at the La Compagnie lounge at Newark Airport - don't

articleText.content:
DailyMail.com has contacted La Compagnie for comment regarding Bethenny's video.  

Her disappointment continued when she headed inside their lounge. 

'I'm going to show you the Kraft services,' she said before showcasing a lackluster display of pastries, Frito chips, empty pots of soup, and a disappointing pretzel section.

'WHAT IS THIS???' she had written as she opened the lids of the pots.

'3200, one way. You know I'll tell you when expensive sh*t is not worth it. This is garbouj!' she said. 

She did, however, praise the employees working behind the scenes.

'Note, the people are working so hard here, I gave them a great tip,' she mentioned.

She was in disbelief as she munched on a plate of nachos beside her fiance Paul Bernon. The chips, Bethenny pointed out, appeared to be Tostitos Scoops.

Bethenny was also mortified by the bathroom, branding it a 's**t show.

articleText.headline: Bethenny Frankel flaunts HUGE engagement ring from Paul Bernon

articleText.caption: Incredulous: Frankel showed off the nearly empty pots of soup awaiting travelers inside the lounge
Nope: Frankel was disappointed to see a container of Clorox wipes sitting on the sink
Rated 'DISGUSTO': Frankel branded the entire experience 'disgusto'

articleText.content:
A package of Clorox wipes sat on the sink, dirty towels for the shower remained in sight, and two unsightly garbage cans were also in view.

'We can keep out the Clorox wipes and we can keep just two random garbages. And just don't worry, there is just laundry in here when you get in in case you want to do some laundry for the airline.

'What a s**t show!' she exclaimed.

An hour later, Bethenny was disappointed to see the snacks in the lounge had yet to be replenished.

articleText.headline: Bethenny Frankel gives positive review of latest SKIMS socks

articleText.caption: Not so fly! For the price of her $6400 roundtrip flight with La Compagnie, an all-business class airline, Bethenny was flabbergasted by just how disappointing their terminal was
Word of warning: Frankel loves giving brutally-honest reviews of products on her social media

articleText.content:
In addition, her lunch was still sitting on her table 20 minutes after she left.

'This is really something else,' she said.

'It's just shocking so far,' she said.

As she walked by a sign advertising the lounge, she wrote, 'And the rating is DISGUSTO!'

articles.headline: EXCLUSIVE: Kourtney Kardashian's pregnancy empire! Reality star is set to earn a FORTUNE from her unborn baby by 'expanding kids clothing line as well as motherhood-focused products through Poosh and Lemme'
articles.socialHeadline: Kourtney Kardashian aims to earn a fortune from pregnancy

relatedArticles.headline: Travis Barker branded sister-in-law Kim Kardashian 'f**king hot', 'curvy eye candy' and gushed over flirtation in unearthed quotes... amid her TOXIC feud with Kourtney
Kourtney Kardashian's friends SHUT DOWN Kim's claim that they are part of an anti-Kourtney group chat: SKIMS founder 'threw us under the bus'
Kim Kardashian bares sculpted midriff in sizzling new snaps for SKIMS... as her feud with Kourtney rages on in front of the cameras

articles.previewText: Kourtney, 44 - who is pregnant with her first child with Travis, 47, aims to make a fortune off of her unborn baby, which was announced at the Blink 182 drummer's LA concert on June 16. Find out how.

articleText.content:
• Kourtney, 44, recently announced she was pregnant with husband Travis, 47
  • A source says she plans to add vitamins for reproductive health to her new brand
  • The reality star has also been selling maternity wear on Poosh since 2019 
  • READ HERE: Kourtney and Travis disclose the sex of their unborn baby with an over-the-top gender reveal party  

Pregnant Kourtney Kardashian is set to earn a fortune with plans to expand her kids clothing line, as well as adding motherhood and wellness products to her lifestyle brands.

A well-placed Kardashian family insider told DailyMail.com exclusively that 44-year-old Kourtney - who is expecting her first child with Blink 182 drummer Travis Barker, 47 - is 'definitely going to use this pregnancy for profit.' 

'Kourtney is honestly grabbing for straws right now and is going to try and milk this pregnancy for all it's worth because she desperately wants what her sisters all have. But she's going about it wrong,' the source said.

'Kim's SKIMS is a massive success because it is very much in line with what she is about: body confidence. Khloe's Good American was created for women who struggle with weight, which is something she fought with for years in front of the world. 

'Kylie started with just one lip kit after her massive lips were the only thing that people talked about at the time. They were her signature.'

articleText.caption: Kourtney Kardashian (pictured in a recent selfie shared with her 223 million Instagram followers), 44, plans to make a fortune from her unborn baby boy, a source told DailyMail.com
Kourtney already has a line of baby clothes with Kardashian Kids and an active line of maternity wear (pictured) that she sells on Poosh, which she started in 2019
In February, Kourtney created a gummy for 'vaginal wellness' through her new company, Lemme, and a source has since told DailyMail.com she plans to expand on reproductive health
Two of Kourtney's three deliveries were aired on KUWTK, including her eldest son Mason in 2009. She plans to share special moments during her current pregnancy on their Hulu show

articleText.content:
Kourtney founded lifestyle brand Poosh in 2019 and launched her range of vitamins and supplements, Lemme, last year, with the source saying she was eyeing off building on these ventures amidst her pregnancy.

'She already has developed a clothing line, Kardashian Kids, that is sold at Babies R' Us, Lord & Taylor, Zappos, Nordstrom and Hudson Bay. She also has an active line of maternity wear that she sells on Poosh,' they added.

'Kourtney's going to continue to build on these brands and add products to both Poosh and Lemme, which she will push heavily on her social media.'

The source added that it would be an 'easy sell' to her 223 million devoted Instagram followers. 

As fans who follow the famous family know, Kourtney aired two of the births of her three children - Mason, 13, Penelope, 10, and Reign, eight - with ex Scott Disick, 39, on their former reality show Keeping Up With The Kardashians, which ran for 20 seasons from 2007 until 2021.

And according to the source, 'Kourtney knows that this baby gives her a ongoing storyline on The Kardashians, which will also generate her a massive income.'

They added that Kourtney was also working on Lemme supplements for reproductive health.

'Knowing that all her attempts have basically failed, she is trying to figure out a way to have what her sisters have. She knows that this pregnancy has gotten people's eyes on her,' the source said.

articleText.caption: The reality star and media mogul (holding her belly during a behind-the-scenes photoshoot for her new line of gummies, Lemme) is 'definitely going to use her pregnancy to profit'
Kourtney (seen in an ad for Lemme in December 2022) was going add products to both Poosh and Lemme, the source said
The gummies contain pineapple, vitamin C and probiotics. The mother-of-three posed in a yellow outfit with cats walking around her in circles to plug the gummies

articleText.headline: Kourtney Kardashian reveals Lemme vaginal health gummy in ad

articleText.content: 'She is hoping that this leads her to what she has been longing for, which is a brand that people can relate to, which is relatable to her, and makes her millions. She knows Lemme and Poosh [aren't] it but is going to continue pushing this pregnancy on them because, as of right now, they are all she has.'

DailyMail.com has contacted Kourtney's representatives via Poosh and Lemme.

Hulu, which currently streams The Kardashians, recently struck a deal with the family for 20 more episodes. 

The announcement was made prior to the season three premiere on May 25.

Prior to season one's start in 2022, Variety reported that the Kardashian-Jenner clan were paid $100 million for two seasons and 40 episodes. That reportedly earned Kourtney between $7.5 million and $8.3 million per season.

If Kourtney lets cameras inside of her delivery and the baby's first days, as she has done with all of her previous children, this will surely keep fans tuning in to see all of these memorable events unfold. 

DailyMail.com spoke exclusively to New-York based marketing agency experts Amra and Elma and - although they would not comment on Kourtney's pregnancy journey specifically - they did share details about how she could use The Kardashians to generate income.

'Some celebrities share their pregnancy journey on a reality TV show, often documenting the raw reality and sometimes difficulties that are often not revealed by everyday women due to embarrassment and privacy reasons,' Elma said. 

'As pregnancy has a very narrow window frame, maternity brands are always scouting for public figures to promote their products, e.g. to model the clothing while visibly pregnant to give other expectant mothers ideas on how to style their look, to talk about which supplements are best to take during pregnancy or which baby products are their favorite.

'Public figures must become creative in order to foster attention and ultimately sell products, and sometimes pregnancy is seen as an opportunity to do just that.'

It is no secret that Kourtney is a master at marketing herself and her products on her social media and company websites, as she has been doing it for years.

And the eldest Kardashian is no stranger to brand deals either. In 2022, Kourtney struck a deal with clothing giant Boohoo. That collection includes very affordable maternity clothes, including T-shirts and dresses, that range from $6 to $35. 

At the time of writing, the maternity items were listed at 60 per cent off normal retail value. 

In 2019, after the birth of her youngest child, Reign, Kourtney launched Poosh, which she calls 'a modern guide to living your best life.'

Since its launch, Kourtney has authored a slew of articles on pregnancy that are included in a section appropriately called 'Motherhood.'

articleText.caption: Kourtney was surrounded by niece North West, 10, daughter Penelope, 10, and stepdaughter Alabama Barker, 17, when she announced her pregnancy on June 16
Kourtney - who officially stopped IVF treatments in February 2022 - captioned her post: 'Overwhelmed with gratitude and joy for God's blessing and plan'

articleText.headline: Kourtney Kardashian shares inside look at gender reveal bash

articleText.content:
In one recent article titled Kourtney's Pregnancy Secrets, the reality star shares tips for expectant mothers. Throughout the article she promotes various products that she endorses, one of these being a cleanse.

'I worked with an amazing Ayurvedic teacher, Martha Soffer, to guide me through the panchakarma cleanse,' she gushed.

The cleanse itself, a five-day treatment, goes for $3,999.

In addition to tips and tricks for the pregnant woman, Kourtney also sells her own line of maternity wear on Poosh. Her clothing ranges from $24.99 to more than $250. Several items in her maternity wear section are currently sold out.

Meanwhile Kourtney's newest venture, Lemme, is a line of vitamins and supplements that are 'good for the body and taste good.'

On its website, she says: 'I made them so delicious you won't believe they're this good for you.'

However, she has gotten some heat recently over one product that is meant to promote 'vaginal wellness.'

articleText.title: READ MORE: All the signs Kourtney Kardashian was pregnant

content.caption: Tricks: In more recent posts, Kourtney wore baggy clothes to conceal her bump

articleText.content:
According to Lemme's website, it was developed with 'clinically-studied probiotics to support its taste, odor and freshness, complete with pineapple extract for added sweetness.'

The Lemme Purr gummies are priced at $30 and drew criticism from health experts.

Gynecologists slammed the vaginal wellness gummies, saying there was no scientific evidence they worked and urged people with health concerns to go to the doctor instead of trusting celebrities.

Earlier this month, Kourtney announced her surprise pregnancy with Travis on June 16 at a Blink 182 concert in Los Angeles. 

After holding up a sign that read, 'Travis I'm pregnant,' the drummer - who has two kids, Landon, 19, and Alabama, 17 with his ex-wife Shanna Moakler, 48 - jumped off the stage to give Kourtney a big smooch in front of the thousands of concertgoers.

Recently, the newlyweds also hosted a gender reveal party at their home in Calabasas, California.

In a clip that she shared with her Instagram followers, she was seated on Travis's lap and, as he wailed on the drums, blue streamers shot out to announce that they were expecting a baby boy. 

Kourtney and Travis became romantically involved in late 2020 after nearly a decade of friendship. They made their relationship Instagram official in February 2021 and were engaged by that October.

The couple wed at a courthouse in Santa Barbara in May 2022 before jetting off to Portofino, Italy a week later to hold a lavish wedding at the Dolce & Gabbana mansion in front of their friends and family.

Kourtney has been open with fans about her attempts to conceive a child with husband Travis Barker through in vitro fertilization. 

In 2022, Kourtney first detailed her struggle with IVF on Hulu's The Kardashians. In one episode, Kourtney was at her Calabasas home as mom Kris Jenner came to visit, asking how the doctors went, as her daughter responded: 'Awful.'

Kourtney revealed in confession that their doctor took them 'down this road of doing IVF, and it hasn't been the most amazing experience.'

She also claimed that the 'medication that they have been giving me, they put me into menopause, literally into menopause.'

The star revealed last December that she stopped her IVF journey and said it caused her to spiral into a deep depression among other symptoms.

articleText.headline: Kourtney Kardashian watches Travis rock Madison Square Garden

articleText.content:
In the season premiere episode of season three of The Kardashians, the Poosh founder further discussed the couple's choice to discontinue IVF and how she'd frozen her eggs in her 30s.

'We would love a baby more than anything but I just really believe in what God has in store for us,' she explained.

She told her sister, Khloe, that she and Travis already 'have a full, blessed life' without a child, so they were not letting it get them down.

'All the thing that came with IVF took a toll on me physically. My health is still impacted because it's hormones. And also mentally it took a toll,' she explained.

'So, I think just being happy is most important and being a good parent to my kids. We are just embracing that whatever is meant to be will be.'

Kourtney previously said that motherhood is her 'favorite role in life' and that it 'gives me purpose.'
